documentType: USCIS Form I-914 Supplement B (Law Enforcement Declaration for T-Visa)
summary: This is a U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services Form I-914 Supplement B, completed by an FBI Special Agent, certifying that an applicant is a victim of a severe form of sex trafficking. The declaration states the applicant was recruited and abused by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell from approximately 2003 to 2008, cooperated with the investigation, and fears retaliation if removed from the United States.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified as the individual who recruited, harbored, obtained, and coerced the applicant into sex acts through force and threats, causing physical injuries.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Identified alongside Epstein as a suspect/defendant in the criminal investigation; the applicant fears retaliation from individuals connected to Maxwell.

connections.description: Both are named as suspects/defendants in the same criminal investigation for trafficking, and threats against the applicant are attributed to individuals connected to both.
Epstein recruited, harbored, obtained, coerced, threatened, and forced the applicant into sex acts, resulting in physical injuries.
The applicant participated in the investigation and prosecution of criminal charges against Maxwell and fears retaliation from individuals connected to her.

events.title: Period of Victimization
events.description: The applicant was recruited, harbored, and abused by Jeffrey Epstein and others for purposes of a coercive sexual relationship.

events.title: Investigation Initiated
events.description: The criminal investigation into acts of trafficking related to this victim was initiated.

events.title: Investigation/Prosecution Completed
events.description: The investigation or prosecution related to this victim's case was completed.

locations: 26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY 10278 (FBI New York Field Office)
keyFacts: A law enforcement officer certifies an individual is a victim of severe sex trafficking perpetrated by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
The victimization occurred from approximately 2003 to 2008, involving coercion, force, threats, and physical abuse by Epstein.
The victim cooperated with the FBI investigation into Epstein and Maxwell, participating in multiple meetings.
The victim and family members have received threats, and the victim fears serious harm and retaliation from individuals connected to Epstein and Maxwell if removed from the U.S.
The underlying criminal statutes investigated include 18 USC 1591 (sex trafficking) and 18 USC 2423 (transportation for illegal sexual activity).
